theoryTitle: Saul Survived the Ohara Buster Call
theoryText: Many fans theorized that Jaguar D. Saul survived the Buster Call and the ice attack from Aokiji. The theory suggested that Saul was frozen but not killed, and that he might return later in the story. This theory was later confirmed in the manga when it was revealed that Saul protected Ohara's books in Elbaf's Owl Library for 22 years.
author: One Piece Community

theoryText: Fans theorized that the books and knowledge from the Tree of Knowledge weren't completely destroyed in the Buster Call. The theory suggested that some scholars or allies managed to save books by throwing them into the lake, and that this knowledge would resurface later in the story. This was confirmed when it was revealed that Saul and the giants preserved Ohara's library in Elbaf.
author: One Piece Community

theoryTitle: The World Government Feared What Ohara Discovered
theoryText: The theory suggests that Ohara's scholars had actually discovered critical information about the Ancient Kingdom and the true history of the Void Century, including potentially the name of the ancient kingdom and the reason for its destruction. The World Government's extreme reaction (Buster Call genocide) indicates they had found something truly threatening to the current world order, not just that they were researching forbidden topics.
author: One Piece Community

theoryText: Fans theorized that Dr. Vegapunk, as the world's greatest scientist, would eventually continue the research that Ohara's scholars died protecting. The theory suggested Vegapunk would seek out surviving Ohara knowledge and study the Void Century despite the World Government's prohibition. This was later confirmed when it was revealed that Vegapunk secretly traveled to Elbaf to read the salvaged Ohara books.
author: One Piece Community

theoryText: This theory explores how Olvia's decision not to reveal herself to Robin, while protective, ultimately contributed to Robin's decades of loneliness and feeling unwanted. If Olvia had reunited with Robin before the Buster Call, Robin might have had different memories and motivations. The theory discusses the tragedy of maternal sacrifice and whether it was ultimately the right choice.
author: One Piece Community

theoryTitle: Aokiji's Role at Ohara Connected to His Later Actions
theoryText: Fans theorized that Aokiji's (Kuzan's) participation in the Ohara Buster Call deeply affected him and influenced his later decision to spare Robin and eventually leave the Marines. The theory suggests that witnessing the destruction of Ohara and seeing the scholars' dedication to knowledge created moral conflicts that shaped his character throughout the series.
author: One Piece Community
